title: School Library Self-Evaluation and Integrated SocialÂ·Civic Competency Enhancement Program: Designing Civic Participation and Education-Society Linkage Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of school library operations, experience with educational policies and self-assessment tools, foundational knowledge of community collaboration projects, and experience designing citizen-participatory programs
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (BYOD) to combine online modules with face-to-face workshops, strengthening case-sharing and reflective practice competencies based on school library evaluation experiences. Special focus is placed on citizen-participatory library operation cases, education-community linkage program design, and exploring community collaboration strategies considering historical/geographical contexts.

learning_goals: Systematically diagnose current operational status of school libraries, derive educational and social improvement directions, and establish strategies to strengthen civic collaboration networks

Using the five core indicators (space utilization, resource accessibility, program connectivity, community collaboration, curriculum alignment) of the 'Improve Your Library' self-assessment process, learners will draft a school development plan within two weeks and achieve over 80% suitability scores in peer reviews and expert evaluations, with particular emphasis on community collaboration and curriculum alignment indicators

Learners will share assessment results (course satisfaction, achievement data, etc.) with three or more peer vocational training institutions, develop an action plan for building civic collaboration networks, derive and implement two reflective practice strategies, incorporating civic engagement approaches that consider cultural and political contexts
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
